attributes.comment:
The proposed fee increases constitute an unreasonable burden for naturalization
applicants and their US citizen families. I am a US citizen married to a foreign
national who is hoping to naturalize in two years. If the proposed fee increases go
into effect it will absolutely keep him from applying. We are a young, middle
class couple. I go to school full time and work part time, and he is employed full
time. There is no way we could come up with the increased filing fees. It's not
about citizenship being something one must be willing to sacrifice for. We do
value citizenship, and we have both sacrificed substantially (financially and
otherwise) just for him to become a Legal Permanent Resident. The citizenship
fees as they stand will be a challenge for us to pay. If the proposed fee increases
go into effect, his citizenship will be delayed for years. It wouldn't be financially
responsible for us to even consider applying until I am out of school, some of my
student loans are paid off, and we have secured other costly priorities such as
health insurance.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Rebecca L. Wey
